data.title: Emile VANDERVELDE, Charles H. Kerr trans
data.meta_description: Chicago: Charles H. Kerr Co. Cooperative, 1919. First Edition in English. Hardcover. 12mo. Pp. 229. Dark red cloth, titles stamped in black on the spine, blind stamped borders on the covers. Spine ends rubbed and very light spots to covers, head edge dust soiled, leaves crisp and bright, binding tight. Very Good. Item #7306 My thesis, in substance, is that we should guard against
data.meta_site_name: Long Brothers Fine and Rare Books
data.text:
"My thesis, in substance, is that we should guard against confusing Socialism with Statism." Vandervelde (1866-1938) was a leader in the Belgian Labor Party and deeply involved in international socialism.

Founded in 1866, the Kerr Co. continues publishing in the field of radical politics.

A scarce title in the original edition.
